revised_title: Advances in Facial Image Processing and Expressive Face Synthesis
tldr: This article discusses the development of computer models for synthesizing expressive faces. The authors present a deformable lattice model for facial tissue and a parametric muscle model to simulate facial expressions. They also explore methods for extracting control parameters from video sequences, enabling more realistic facial animation. The research has implications for improving the visual fidelity of animated faces in various applications.
